page.title: 05INTERESTING BUILDINGS CONT.
page.content: {FERN COTTAGE__}This is an eighteenth century house containing fragments of one much older and showing to perfection the flat stone arches which are so much a feature of the vernacular tradition here. {THE OLD BROOK HOUSE__}It was built 250 years ago (1732). It was first a pub called the Farmers Arms. Then a violin maker took the house. Next a miller took it, on the third floor he kept flour and corn. That was 80 years ago. It was split into two houses. Mr. Broadley who was a butcher moved in next. After he died the council took it. The council were going to pull it down but they didn't. In 1960 the present owners bought the house. When they first moved in there was no garden only a field.
